sen.j: 吉雄 耕牛（よしお こうぎゅう、享保9年（1724年） - 寛政12年8月16日（1800年10月4日）））は、日本の江戸時代中期のオランダ語通詞（江戸幕府公式通訳）、蘭方医。
sen.e: Kogyu YOSHIO (1724 - October 4, 1800) was a Ranpoi (a person who studied Western medicine by means of the Dutch language) and Dutch translator who lived during the mid-Edo period.

Kogyu YOSHIO (1724 - October 4, 1800) was a Ranpoi (a person who studied Western medicine by means of the Dutch language) and a Japanese-Dutch interpreter (official interpreter of the Edo shogunate) who lived during the middle of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ、訳語選択ミスがあります。「通詞」は通訳の仕事がメインなので「interpreter」。
sen.e: Kogyu YOSHIO (1724 - October 4, 1800) was a Ranpoi (a person who studied Western medicine by means of the Dutch language) and a Japanese-Dutch interpreter (official interpreter of the Edo shogunate) who lived during the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 諱は永章、通称は定次郎、のち幸左衛門。
sen.e: His real personal name was Eisho and he was commonly known as Teijiro and later Kozaemon.
His real name was Eisho, and his common name was Teijiro which later changed to Kozaemon.
His real name was Eisho, and his common name was Teijiro which later changed to Kozaemon.

sen.j: 幸作とも称する。
sen.e: He also called himself Kosaku.
He also called himself Kosaku.
He also called himself Kosaku.

sen.j: 号は耕牛のほか養浩斎など。
sen.e: He was also known under the name of Kogyu or Yokosai.
He was also known under the name of Kogyu or Yokosai.
He was also known under the name of Kogyu or Yokosai.

sen.j: 父は吉雄藤三郎。
sen.e: His father was Tozaburo YOSHIO.
His father was Tozaburo YOSHIO.
His father was Tozaburo YOSHIO.

sen.j: 吉雄家は代々オランダ通詞を勤めた家系。
sen.e: The Yoshio family produced Dutch translators for generations.
The Yoshio family had served as Dutch interpreter for generations.
The Yoshio family had served as Dutch interpreter for generations.

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 享保9年（1724年）、藤三郎の長男として長崎に出生。
sen.e: In 1724, he was born as the first son of Tozaburo in Nagasaki.
In 1724, he was born as the first son of Tozaburo in Nagasaki.
In 1724, he was born as the first son of Tozaburo in Nagasaki.

sen.j: 幼い頃からオランダ語を学び、元文2年（1737年）14歳のとき稽古通詞、寛保2年（1742年）には小通詞に進み、寛延元年（1748年）には25歳の若さで大通詞となった。
sen.e: He started learning Dutch from an early age and became a trainee translator at the age of 14 in 1737, assistant translator in 1742, and then translator in chief at the age of 25 in 1748.
He started learning Dutch from an early age and became a trainee interpreter at the age of 14 in 1737, assistant interpreter in 1742, and then chief interpreter at the age of 25 in 1748.
He started learning Dutch from an early age and became a trainee interpreter at the age of 14 in 1737, assistant interpreter in 1742, and then chief interpreter at the age of 25 in 1748.

sen.j: 年番通詞、江戸番通詞（毎年のカピタンの江戸参府に随行）をたびたび勤めた。
sen.e: He was appointed to the post of Translator of a Year several times and accompanied the Kapitan (curator of a Dutch trading house) on their yearly visit to Edo.

He was appointed several times Nenban-tsushi (interpreter who served every other year) and Edoban-tsushi (interpreter who accompanied Kapitan [curator of the Dutch trading house of Nagasaki] on their every year's visit to Edo).

He was appointed several times Nenban-tsushi (interpreter who served every other year) and Edoban-tsushi (interpreter who accompanied Kapitan [curator of the Dutch trading house of Nagasaki] on their every year's visit to Edo).

sen.j: 通詞の仕事のかたわら、商館付の医師やオランダ語訳の外科書から外科医術を学ぶ。
sen.e: In addition to working as a translator, he studied surgery both from doctors working for this Dutch trading house and surgery textbooks in Dutch.
While working as interpreter, he learned surgery both from doctors working at the Dutch trading house and from surgery textbooks in Dutch.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: While working as interpreter, he learned surgery both from doctors working at the Dutch trading house and from surgery textbooks in Dutch.

sen.j: 特にバウエル（G.R.Bauer）やカール・ツンベルク（C.P.Thunberg。スウェーデン人でカール・フォン・リンネの高弟）とは親交を結び、当時日本で流行していた梅毒の治療法として水銀水療法を伝授され、実際の診療に応用した。
sen.e: He was especially on close terms with G. R. Bauer and Carl P. Thunberg (Swedish leading disciple of Carl von Linné) and learned to treat syphilis, which was epidemic in Japan at the time, with mercury water.

He was on close terms especially with G. R. Bauer and Carl P. Thunberg (Swedish leading disciple of Carl von Linné), and learned mercury treatment from them to treat syphilis which was epidemic in Japan in those days, and applied it to actual treatments.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: He was on close terms especially with G. R. Bauer and Carl P. Thunberg (Swedish leading disciple of Carl von Linné), and learned mercury treatment from them to treat syphilis which was epidemic in Japan in those days, and applied it to actual treatments.

sen.j: オランダ語、医術の他に天文学、地理学、本草学なども修め、また蘭学を志す者にそれを教授した。
sen.e: In addition to mastering Dutch and medicine, he also learned astronomy, geography, and herbalism and taught Rangaku (study of Western sciences by means of the Dutch language).
He mastered not only Dutch and medicine but also astronomy, geography, and herbalism, and taught those learning to people who aimed to master Rangaku (Western learning).
He mastered not only Dutch and medicine but also astronomy, geography, and herbalism, and taught those learning to people who aimed to master Rangaku (Western learning).

sen.j: 家塾である成秀館には、全国からの入門者があいついだ。
sen.e: He had many students from all over the country at his private school, Seishukan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He had many students from all over the country at his private school, Seishukan.
He had many students from all over the country at his private school, Seishukan.

sen.j: 彼が創始した吉雄流紅毛外科は楢林鎮山の楢林流と双璧を為す紅毛外科（西洋医学）として広まった。
sen.e: The Yoshio technique of Western surgery established by him, together with the Narabayashi technique of Western surgery established by Chinzan NARABAYASHI, became the most popularly practiced Western surgery (or medical science) at the time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Yoshio Western surgery established by him became popular as a school of Western surgery which could rival the Narabayashi Western surgery established by Chinzan NARABAYASHI.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: The Yoshio Western surgery established by him became popular as a school of Western surgery which could rival the Narabayashi Western surgery established by Chinzan NARABAYASHI.

sen.j: 吉雄邸の2階にはオランダから輸入された家具が配され「阿蘭陀坐敷」などと呼ばれたという。
sen.e: It is said that his residence was known as the 'Dutch House' as the second floor was decorated with furniture imported from the Netherlands.
It is said that as the second floor of Yoshio's residence was decorated with furniture imported from the Netherlands, it was called 'Dutch room.'
It is said that as the second floor of Yoshio's residence was decorated with furniture imported from the Netherlands, it was called 'Dutch room.'

sen.j: 庭園にもオランダ渡りの動植物にあふれ、長崎の名所となった。
sen.e: The residence also had plenty of Dutch plants and animals in the garden and became a main sight of Nagasaki.
The residence also had plenty of Dutch plants and animals in the garden and became a famous place in Nagasaki.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。この「名所」はいわゆる観光スポットではなく、噂になったくらいの意味です。
sen.e: The residence also had plenty of Dutch plants and animals in the garden and became a famous place in Nagasaki.

sen.j: 同邸では西洋暦の正月に行われる、いわゆる「オランダ正月」の宴も催された。
sen.e: He hosted the so-called 'Dutch New Year' party at beginning of the year in the western calendar.
He hosted the so-called 'Dutch New Year' party in the New Year by Western calendar (the solar calendar).
He hosted the so-called 'Dutch New Year' party in the New Year by Western calendar (the solar calendar).

sen.j: 吉雄邸を訪れ、あるいは成秀館に学んだ蘭学者・医師は数多く、青木昆陽・野呂元丈・大槻玄沢・三浦梅園・平賀源内・林子平・司馬江漢など当時一流の蘭学者は軒並み耕牛と交わり、多くの知識を学んでいる。
sen.e: There were many of Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) and doctors, who visited his residence or leaned at Seishukan, and most of the leading Rangakusha at the time, including Konyo AOKI, Genjo NORO, Gentaku OTSUKI, Baien MIURA, Gennai HIRAGA, Shihei HAYASHI, and Kokan SHIBA, had contact with him and gained much knowledge from him.

There were many of Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) and doctors, who visited Kogyu (Yoshio)'s residence or leaned at Seishukan, and most of the leading Rangakusha at the time, including Konyo AOKI, Genjo NORO, Gentaku OTSUKI, Baien MIURA, Gennai HIRAGA, Shihei HAYASHI, and Kokan SHIBA, had contact with him and gained much knowledge from him.

There were many of Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) and doctors, who visited Kogyu (Yoshio)'s residence or leaned at Seishukan, and most of the leading Rangakusha at the time, including Konyo AOKI, Genjo NORO, Gentaku OTSUKI, Baien MIURA, Gennai HIRAGA, Shihei HAYASHI, and Kokan SHIBA, had contact with him and gained much knowledge from him.

sen.j: 大槻玄沢によれば門人は600余を数えたという。
sen.e: According to Gentaku OTSUKI, Yoshio had more than 600 students.
According to Gentaku OTSUKI, Yoshio had more than 600 students.
According to Gentaku OTSUKI, Yoshio had more than 600 students.

sen.j: 中でも前野良沢・杉田玄白らとの交流は深く、2人が携わった『解体新書』に耕牛は序文を寄せ、両者の功労を賞賛している。
sen.e: He had close relations with Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITA, among others, and praised their achievements by contributing a preface for their book "Kaitai Shinsho" (the historic Japanese translation of a Dutch anatomical text).
Kogyu (Yoshio) had close relations with Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITA among others, and praised their achievements by contributing a foreword for their book "Kaitai Shinsho" (New Book of Anatomy).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ、訳語選択ミスがあります。「序文」はこの場合「foreword」、「解体新書」の訳は位置づけの説明よりも、登録にある普通の訳の方がふさわしいと思います。
sen.e: Kogyu (Yoshio) had close relations with Ryotaku MAENO and Genpaku SUGITA among others, and praised their achievements by contributing a foreword for their book "Kaitai Shinsho" (New Book of Anatomy).

sen.j: また江戸に戻った玄沢は、自らの私塾芝蘭堂で江戸オランダ正月を開催した。
sen.e: Gentaku hosted the Dutch New Year party at his private school, Shiran-do, after returning to Edo.
After returning to Edo, Gentaku hosted Edo-Dutch New Year party at his private school Shiran-do as well.
After returning to Edo, Gentaku hosted Edo-Dutch New Year party at his private school Shiran-do as well.

sen.j: 寛政2年（1790年）、樟脳の輸出に関わる誤訳事件に連座し、蘭語通詞目付の役職を召し上げられ、5年間の蟄居処分を申し渡された。
sen.e: In 1790, he was deprived of his post as inspector of Dutch translation and sentenced to a five-year house confinement as he had been involved in the mistranslation regarding a camphor export.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1790, he was deprived of his post as inspector of Dutch interpreters and sentenced to a five-year house confinement as he had been involved in the mistranslation regarding a camphor export.
In 1790, he was deprived of his post as inspector of Dutch interpreters and sentenced to a five-year house confinement as he had been involved in the mistranslation regarding a camphor export.

sen.j: 復帰後は同8年（1796年）蛮学指南役を命じられた。
sen.e: However, he was appointed to the post of instructor of Western studies after serving the house confinement in 1796.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After return-to-work, in 1796, he was appointed to the post of instructor of Western studies.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: After return-to-work, in 1796, he was appointed to the post of instructor of Western studies.

sen.j: 寛政12年（1800年）に平戸町（現在の長崎市江戸町の一部）の自邸で病没。
sen.e: In 1800, he died of illness at his residence in Hirado-cho (present-day Edo-cho, Nagasaki City).
In 1800, he died of illness at his residence in Hirado-cho (present Edo-machi, Nagasaki City).
sen.cmt: 読み間違いがあります。「江戸町」は「えどまち」。
sen.e: In 1800, he died of illness at his residence in Hirado-cho (present Edo-machi, Nagasaki City).

sen.j: 享年77。
sen.e: He was 77 years old.
He died at the age of 77.
He died at the age of 77.

sen.j: 法名は閑田耕牛。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Kogyu KANDEN.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Kogyu KANDEN.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Kogyu KANDEN.

sen.j: 訳書には『和蘭（紅毛）流膏薬方』、『正骨要訣』、『布斂吉黴瘡篇』、『因液発備』（耕牛の口述を没後に刊行。のちに江馬蘭斎が『五液診方』として別に訳出）など。
sen.e: His translated works included the "Waran (Komo) Ryuko Yakuho" (Dutch [Western] Popular Drugs), the "Seikotsu Yoketsu" (Summary of Osteopathy), the "Purenki Baisohen" (Plenck's Book on Syphilis), and the "Ineki Happi" (Human Excretory Mechanism) (published after the death of Yoshio but based on his oral statements and later retranslated and published by Ransai EMA under the name of the "Goeki Shinpo").
sen.cmt: 『和蘭（紅毛）流膏薬方』、『正骨要訣』、『布斂吉黴瘡篇』、『因液発備』『五液診方』の定訳不明
sen.e: His translated works included "Waran-ryu (Komo-ryu) Koyaku-ho" (Dutch [Western] Salve Prescription), "Seikotsu Yoketsu" (Summary of Osteopathy), "Plenck Baiso-hen" (Plenck's Book on Syphilis), and "Ineki Happi" (Excretory Mechanism) (published after the death of Yoshio but based on his oral statements and later retranslated and published by Ransai EMA under the name of the "Goeki Shinpo").

His translated works included "Waran-ryu (Komo-ryu) Koyaku-ho" (Dutch [Western] Salve Prescription), "Seikotsu Yoketsu" (Summary of Osteopathy), "Plenck Baiso-hen" (Plenck's Book on Syphilis), and "Ineki Happi" (Excretory Mechanism) (published after the death of Yoshio but based on his oral statements and later retranslated and published by Ransai EMA under the name of the "Goeki Shinpo").

sen.j: 通訳・医術の分野でともに優れた耕牛であったが、子息のうち医術は吉雄永久が、通詞は吉雄権之助がそれぞれ受け継いだ。
sen.e: He showed outstanding achievements both in the area of translation and medical science and his sons, Eikyu YOSHIO and Gonnosuke YOSHIO, became a doctor and translator, respectively.
He showed outstanding achievements both in the area of interpretation and medical science, and his sons, Eikyu YOSHIO as doctor and Gonnosuke YOSHIO as interpreter, succeeded Yoshio's works.
He showed outstanding achievements both in the area of interpretation and medical science, and his sons, Eikyu YOSHIO as doctor and Gonnosuke YOSHIO as interpreter, succeeded Yoshio's works.

sen.j: 権之助の門人に高野長英らがいる。
sen.e: Gonnosuke's students included Choei TAKANO.
Gonnosuke's students included Choei TAKANO.
Gonnosuke's students included Choei TAKANO.

sen.j: 評伝に片桐一男『江戸の蘭方医学事始 阿蘭陀通詞・吉雄幸左衛門耕牛』（丸善ライブラリー、2000年）。
sen.e: His critical biography, "Edo no Ranpoigaku Kotohajime - Oranda Tsushi YOSHIO Kozaemon Kogyu" (Notes on Dutch Medicine of the Edo period - Dutch translator, YOSHIO Kozaemon Kogyu) (Maruzen Library, 2000), was written by Kazuo KTAGIRI.
sen.cmt: 『江戸の蘭方医学事始 阿蘭陀通詞・吉雄幸左衛門耕牛』の定訳不明
sen.e: There is his critical biography "Edo no Ranpoigaku Kotohajime - Oranda Tsushi YOSHIO Kozaemon Kogyu" (The Beginning of Dutch Medicine of the Edo period - Dutch translator, YOSHIO Kozaemon Kogyu) (Maruzen Library, 2000) written by Kazuo KATAGIRI.
sen.cmt: 写し間違い、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: There is his critical biography "Edo no Ranpoigaku Kotohajime - Oranda Tsushi YOSHIO Kozaemon Kogyu" (The Beginning of Dutch Medicine of the Edo period - Dutch translator, YOSHIO Kozaemon Kogyu) (Maruzen Library, 2000) written by Kazuo KATAGIRI.
